author: dp_specialist
content: does anyone knows if is it possible to count how many times transactions inside a block make a call to a precompile contract?

author: dp_specialist
content: just looking at etherscan, what it is possible is to check for transactions that involve smart contracts, and then inside the solidity code (if it was made public), parse the code and look for the precompile calls

author: bchain99
content: i implemented code to check if a tx does a uniswap v3 eth/usdc swap here

author: bchain99
content: basically parsing the tx from its traces. maybe you can do something similar for pre-compiles

author: dp_specialist
content: The only thing I don't like with the idea of checking solidity code is that it depends on its availability. Would it be possible to know if a precompile was called even when there is no code available?

author: bchain99
content: i think as long as the pre-compile is executed as a tx you could maybe check its traces

author: bchain99
content: i m not really sure how pre-compiles work tbh lol

author: dp_specialist
content: there are certain EVM memory addresses for that. One alternative could be to check if a contract wrote something into those addresses.
